message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only Serotonin is correctly paired with the Raphe nucleus as its location of synthesis. Norepinephrine is synthesized in the locus coeruleus, GABA in the substantia nigra and globus pallidus, and Acetylcholine in the basal forebrain.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Serotonin is synthesized in the raphe nucleus, while Norepinephrine is synthesized in the locus coeruleus. GABA is synthesized in the substantia nigra and globus pallidus, while Acetylcholine is synthesized in the basal forebrain and brainstem cholinergic nuclei. Therefore, the correct answer is (C) Serotonin -- Raphe nucleus.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Serotonin is synthesized in the Raphe nucleus. Norepinephrine is synthesized in the locus coeruleus, GABA in the substantia nigra, and Acetylcholine in the basal forebrain cholinergic system. Therefore, the correct answer is (C).

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Serotonin is synthesized in the raphe nucleus. Norepinephrine is synthesized in the locus coeruleus, GABA in the basal ganglia and Acetylcholine in the basal forebrain. Therefore, option (C) is correct.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Serotonin is synthesized in and released from neurons in the Raphe nuclei of the brainstem. Norepinephrine is synthesized in the locus coeruleus, GABA in various regions of the brain, and acetylcholine in the basal forebrain and pontine tegmentum.

Norepinephrine is synthesized in the locus coeruleus, GABA is synthesized in the substantia nigra and striatum, and acetylcholine is synthesized in the basal forebrain and brainstem.

GABA is synthesized in the Substantia nigra and Globus pallidus, while Acetylcholine is synthesized in the Basal forebrain and Pontomesencephalic tegmentum. Therefore, the correct answer is (C).
